text: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the command of God our Savior and Christ Jesus our confidence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Timothy, a genuine child in faith.
Good will, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord are yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: When I was going to the province of Macedonia, I encouraged you to stay in the city of Ephesus. That way you could order certain people to stop teaching false doctrine
speaker: Narrator

text: and occupying themselves with myths and endless genealogies. These myths and genealogies raise a lot of questions rather than promoting God’s plan, which centers in faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: My goal in giving you this order is for love to flow from a pure heart, from a clear conscience, and from a sincere faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some people have left these qualities behind and have turned to useless discussions.
speaker: Narrator

text: They want to be experts in Moses’ Teachings. However, they don’t understand what they’re talking about or the things about which they speak so confidently.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that the laws in Moses’ Teachings are good if they are used as they were intended to be used.
speaker: Narrator

text: For example, a person must realize that those laws are not intended for people who have God’s approval. Laws are intended for lawbreakers and rebels, for ungodly people and sinners, for those who think nothing is holy or sacred, for those who kill their fathers, their mothers, or other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Laws are intended for people involved in sexual sins, for homosexuals, for kidnappers, for liars, for those who lie when they take an oath, and for whatever else is against accurate teachings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses’ Teachings were intended to be used in agreement with the Good News that contains the glory of the blessed God. I was entrusted with that Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank Christ Jesus our Lord that he has trusted me and has appointed me to do his work with the strength he has given me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the past I cursed him, persecuted him, and acted arrogantly toward him. However, I was treated with mercy because I acted ignorantly in my unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our Lord was very kind  to me. Through his kindness he brought me to faith and gave me the love that Christ Jesus shows people.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a statement that can be trusted and deserves complete acceptance: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, and I am the foremost sinner.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, I was treated with mercy so that Christ Jesus could use me, the foremost sinner, to demonstrate his patience. This patience serves as an example for those who would believe in him and live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Worship and glory belong forever to the eternal king, the immortal, invisible, and only God. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, my child, I’m giving you this order about the prophecies that are still coming to you: Use these prophecies in faith and with a clear conscience to fight this noble war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some have refused to let their faith guide their conscience and their faith has been destroyed like a wrecked ship.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among these people are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan in order to teach them not to dishonor God.
speaker: Narrator

text: First of all, I encourage you to make petitions, prayers, intercessions, and prayers of thanks for all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: for rulers, and for everyone who has authority over us. Pray for these people so that we can have a quiet and peaceful life always lived in a godly and reverent way.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is good and pleases God our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: He wants all people to be saved and to learn the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one God. There is also one mediator between God and humans—a human, Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sacrificed himself for all people to free them from their sins.
This message is valid for every era.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was appointed to spread this Good News and to be an apostle to teach people who are not Jewish about faith and truth. I’m telling you the truth. I’m not lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: I want men to offer prayers everywhere. They should raise their hands in prayer after putting aside their anger and any quarrels they have with anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: I want women to show their beauty by dressing in appropriate clothes that are modest and respectable. Their beauty will be shown by what they do, not by their hair styles or the gold jewelry, pearls, or expensive clothes they wear.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what is proper for women who claim to have reverence for God.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman must learn in silence, in keeping with her position.
speaker: Narrator

text: I don’t allow a woman to teach or to have authority over a man. Instead, she should be quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, Adam was formed first, then Eve.
speaker: Narrator

text: Besides that, Adam was not deceived. It was the woman who was deceived and sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, she and all women will be saved through the birth of the child, if they lead respectable lives in faith, love, and holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a statement that can be trusted: If anyone sets his heart on being a bishop, he desires something excellent.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bishop must have a good reputation. He must have only one wife, be sober, use good judgment, be respectable, be hospitable, and be able to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not drink excessively or be a violent person, but he must be gentle. He must not be quarrelsome or love money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must manage his own family well. His children should respectfully obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text: (If a man doesn’t know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God’s church?)
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not be a new Christian, or he might become arrogant like the devil and be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: People who are not Christians must speak well of him, or he might become the victim of disgraceful insults that the devil sets as traps for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons must also be of good character. They must not be two-faced or addicted to alcohol. They must not use shameful ways to make money.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must have clear consciences about possessing the mystery of the Christian faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: First, a person must be evaluated. Then, if he has a good reputation, he may become a deacon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their wives must also be of good character. They must not be gossips, but they must control their tempers and be trustworthy in every way.
speaker: Narrator

text: A deacon must have only one wife. Deacons must manage their children and their families well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those deacons who serve well gain an excellent reputation and will have confidence as a result of their faith in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hope to visit you soon. However, I’m writing this to you
speaker: Narrator

text: in case I’m delayed. I want you to know how people who are members of God’s family must live. God’s family is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mystery that gives us our reverence for God is acknowledged to be great:
He  appeared in his human nature,
was approved by the Spirit,
was seen by angels,
was announced throughout the nations,
was believed in the world,
and was taken to heaven in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit says clearly that in later times some believers will desert the Christian faith. They will follow spirits that deceive, and they will believe the teachings of demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: These people will speak lies disguised as truth. Their consciences have been scarred as if branded by a red-hot iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will try to stop others from getting married and from eating certain foods. God created food to be received with prayers of thanks by those who believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything God created is good. Nothing should be rejected if it is received with prayers of thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s word and prayer set it apart as holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are a good servant of Christ Jesus when you point these things out to our brothers and sisters. Then you will be nourished by the words of the Christian faith and the excellent teachings which you have followed closely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t have anything to do with godless myths that old women like to tell. Rather, train yourself to live a godly life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Training the body helps a little, but godly living helps in every way. Godly living has the promise of life now and in the world to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a statement that can be trusted and deserves complete acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly, we work hard and struggle to live a godly life, because we place our confidence in the living God. He is the Savior of all people, especially of those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insist on these things and teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t let anyone look down on you for being young. Instead, make your speech, behavior, love, faith, and purity an example for other believers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I get there, concentrate on reading Scripture in worship, giving encouraging messages, and teaching people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t neglect the gift which you received through prophecy when the spiritual leaders  placed their hands on you to ordain you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Practice these things. Devote your life to them so that everyone can see your progress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Focus on your life and your teaching. Continue to do what I’ve told you. If you do this, you will save yourself and those who hear you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Never use harsh words when you correct an older man, but talk to him as if he were your father. Talk to younger men as if they were your brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: older women as if they were your mothers, and younger women as if they were your sisters, while keeping yourself morally pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who have no families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children or grandchildren of a widow must first learn to respect their own family by repaying their parents. This is pleasing in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: A widow who has no family has placed her confidence in God by praying and asking for his help night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the widow who lives for pleasure is dead although she is still alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insist on these things so that widows will have good reputations.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone doesn’t take care of his own relatives, especially his immediate family, he has denied the Christian faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Any widow who had only one husband and is at least 60 years old should be put on your list of widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: People should tell about the good things she has done: raising children, being hospitable, taking care of believers’ needs, helping the suffering, or always doing good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t include younger widows on your list. Whenever their natural desires become stronger than their devotion to Christ, they’ll want to marry.
speaker: Narrator

text: They condemn themselves by rejecting the Christian faith, the faith they first accepted.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time, they learn to go around from house to house since they have nothing else to do. Not only this, but they also gossip and get involved in other people’s business, saying things they shouldn’t say.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I want younger widows to marry, have children, manage their homes, and not give the enemy any chance to ridicule them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them have already turned away to follow Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any woman is a believer and has relatives who are widows, she should help them. In this way the church is not burdened and can help widows who have no families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give double honor to spiritual leaders  who handle their duties well. This is especially true if they work hard at teaching God’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, Scripture says, “Never muzzle an ox when it is threshing  grain,” and “The worker deserves his pay.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t pay attention to an accusation against a spiritual leader unless it is supported by two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reprimand those leaders who sin. Do it in front of everyone so that the other leaders will also be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I solemnly call on you in the sight of God, Christ Jesus, and the chosen angels to be impartial when you follow what I’ve told you. Never play favorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be in a hurry to place your hands on anyone to ordain him. Don’t participate in the sins of others. Keep yourself morally pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stop drinking only water. Instead, drink a little wine for your stomach because you are frequently sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are obvious, going ahead of them to judgment. The sins of others follow them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, the good things that people do are obvious, and those that aren’t obvious can’t remain hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: All slaves who believe must give complete respect to their own masters. In this way no one will speak evil of God’s name and what we teach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Slaves whose masters also believe should respect their masters even though their masters are also believers. As a result, believers who are slaves should serve their masters even better because those who receive the benefit of their work are believers whom they love.
Teach and encourage people to do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever teaches false doctrine and doesn’t agree with the accurate words of our Lord Jesus Christ and godly teachings
speaker: Narrator

text: is a conceited person. He shows that he doesn’t understand anything. Rather, he has an unhealthy desire to argue and quarrel about words. This produces jealousy, rivalry, cursing, suspicion,
speaker: Narrator

text: and conflict between people whose corrupt minds have been robbed of the truth. They think that a godly life is a way to make a profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: A godly life brings huge profits to people who are content with what they have.
speaker: Narrator

text: We didn’t bring anything into the world, and we can’t take anything out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: As long as we have food and clothes, we should be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: But people who want to get rich keep falling into temptation. They are trapped by many stupid and harmful desires which drown them in destruction and ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly, the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. Some people who have set their hearts on getting rich have wandered away from the Christian faith and have caused themselves a lot of grief.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, man of God, must avoid these things. Pursue what God approves of: a godly life, faith, love, endurance, and gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight for the Christian faith. Take hold of everlasting life to which you were called and about which you made a good testimony in front of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the sight of God, who gives life to everything, and in the sight of Christ Jesus, who gave a good testimony in front of Pontius Pilate,
speaker: Narrator

text: I insist that, until our Lord Jesus Christ appears, you obey this command completely. Then you cannot be blamed for doing anything wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the right time God will make this known. God is the blessed and only ruler. He is the King of kings and Lord of lords.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the only one who cannot die. He lives in light that no one can come near. No one has seen him, nor can they see him. Honor and power belong to him forever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell those who have the riches of this world not to be arrogant and not to place their confidence in anything as uncertain as riches. Instead, they should place their confidence in God who richly provides us with everything to enjoy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell them to do good, to do a lot of good things, to be generous, and to share.
speaker: Narrator

text: By doing this they store up a treasure for themselves which is a good foundation for the future. In this way they take hold of what life really is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, guard the Good News which has been entrusted to you. Turn away from pointless discussions and the claims of false knowledge that people use to oppose the Christian faith.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although some claim to have knowledge, they have abandoned the faith.
God’s good will  be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator
